intro: Saurauia bibracteata, commonly known as the two-bracted saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Myanmar, and Thailand. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in white or pink hues. Saurauia bibracteata often grows in shaded, moist forest environments, thriving in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
